snippet: Dozens of lawyers who successfully fought to block Proposition 187, the anti-illegal immigration measure, want to bill the state for $3.1 million in legal costs.    Court records show that 31 lawyers from several civil rights groups have asked a F...
lead_paragraph: Dozens of lawyers who successfully fought to block Proposition 187, the anti-illegal immigration measure, want to bill the state for $3.1 million in legal costs. Court records show that 31 lawyers from several civil rights groups have asked a Federal judge to approve the bills for their fight against the measure, which California voters approved in 1994.
abstract: Thirty-one lawyers from several civil rights groups who successfully challenged proposition approved by California voters in 1994 to deny education and other social services to illegal immigrants seek to bill state for $3.1 million in legal costs (S)

headline.main: Rights Case Lawyers Seek to Bill State
